notesStmt.note: Folios 156v-157r contain lists of books in an Italian cursive hand of the 16 and 17th centuries.Folio 157r contains a number of dates of eclipses according to various calculations.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Sefer malmad ha-talmidim, ethico-philosophical discourse on the passages of the Pentateuch in the order of weekly pericopes by Jacob ben Abba Mari ben Samson Anatoli.

msItem.title: Sefer malmad ha-talmidim ספר מלמד התלמידים

collation.p:
Quires of mostly 10 leaves each.
Marked with catchwords in red ink at the end of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 14th to 15th century. Yehudah: marked off on folios 82v, 92v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Marbled edges. Spine title: 'Jacob Anatolio. Malmad Hat-Talmidim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26, 898.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 7; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [158v].
